tumors.description: Brain tumors are abnormal growths of cells in the brain or spinal cord. They can be benign (non-cancerous) or malignant (cancerous).

tumors.name: Meningioma
tumors.info: Meningiomas are usually slow-growing tumors that arise from the meninges, the protective covering of the brain and spinal cord.

tumors.name: Glioblastoma
tumors.info: Glioblastoma is a fast-growing type of tumor that forms from supportive tissue of the brain.

tumors.name: Pituitary Tumor
tumors.info: Pituitary tumors are abnormal growths that develop in your pituitary gland, a small bean-shaped gland at the base of your brain.

tumors.name: Oligodendroglioma
tumors.info: Oligodendroglioma is a type of brain tumor that originates in the cells that produce myelin, a fatty covering that protects nerves in the brain.

tumors.name: Anaplastic Astrocytoma
tumors.info: Anaplastic astrocytoma is a type of brain tumor that arises from astrocytes, star-shaped cells that support nerve cells.
